DOC.brief_summary: Preoperative chemotherapy is considered to play a role in early stage non small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) .The use of preoperative Cisplatin/Gemcitabine chemotherapy has proven feasible and without excessive morbidity or mortality in the Phase II setting. The aim of the present Phase III study is to determine whether 3 cycles of preoperative chemotherapy with Cisplatin/Gemcitabine improves progression free survival of NSCLC patients versus surgery alone. Postoperative chemotherapy will not be utilized in this Phase III trial.
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Phase III Trial of Surgery Alone or Surgery Plus Preoperative Gemcitabine-Cisplatin in Early Stages NSCLC
DOC.criteria: Main inclusion Criteria: Must have pathologic documentation of nonsmall cell lung cancer, IB, II, IIIA. ECOG Performance Status of 0 1 Bidimensionally measurable disease or evaluable disease Adequate organ function Main exclusion Criteria: Have greater than Grade 1 neuropathy motor/sensory Significant history of cardiac disease Pleural effusion
